formattedAddress: 171 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 171 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
After an extensive search for the ideal specialist, I finally connected with Dr. Walls in September 2023. He was the sixth consultant I met, with previous consultations primarily with podiatrists who didn't perform surgeries. Many referred me to another podiatrist, whose surgical coordinator has yet to schedule a surgery date, seemingly stuck in "summer vacation mode." In my quest for a solution, I discovered Dr. Walls while researching experts in stem cell orthopedics in NYC.

Feeling anxious during my initial visit, especially with x-rays marked by numerous other doctors, I hoped for a straightforward stem cell solution. Dr. Walls, however, explained that my case wasn't standard but reassured me with his confidence in his diagnosis and proposed treatment plan. By December, I underwent surgery and astonishingly returned to the gym with limited activity just three weeks post-operation. Now, at six weeks post-surgery, I'm thrilled to resume my active lifestyle without limitations.

Dr. Walls and his team at NYU Langone have been exceptional - utmost professionals and genuinely compassionate. I wholeheartedly award Dr. Walls and his team 5 stars for their outstanding care and am grateful for their role in alleviating my pain and restoring my active lifestyle.

originalText.text:
Dr. Walls is a top-notch amazing and caring doctor. I was referred to Dr. Walls earlier this year after my 3rd Achilles surgery started to fail. Needless to say, I was really upset and hopeless. I knew I likely needed another surgery but didn’t want another overly ambitious/eager NYC doctor to agree to immediately cutting me open (for the $$$). While I was frustrated by the pain and inability to do any activity, I appreciated Dr. Walls’ treatment approach. We tried a couple of last ditch efforts to save my Achilles. When those efforts failed, we knew surgery was the right next step.

Scheduling was a bit of a challenge and I’d recommend for his coordinator to be more proactive and responsive, but this isn’t a reflection of Dr. Walls’ abilities or NYU as a whole. My husband and I continue to be blown away by the surgery experience I had. Dr. Walls and the NYU staff were exceptional (and I can attest because I’ve had a lot of surgeries). The experience was vastly different than HSS which is where I had my previous Achilles surgery.

I’ve now had 4 Achilles surgeries, which still blows my mind. Dr. Walls is the only doctor who actually took the time before and after the surgery to check in, explain things, and allow me to ask questions. He’s not arrogant or conceited. I’m 5 months post surgery and I have almost no pain. I also recently started running again, which I thought may never happen (I used to be a semi-competitive marathon runner). I’ll probably never be as good as I once was, but the future is promising. I’ll be able to do the activities I love, and that’s what matters.

I highly recommend Dr. Walls and would encourage you to question any negative reviews posted for him, as they’re simply not true. He’s knowledgeable, professional, friendly, and trustworthy, which is very hard to find these days.

originalText.text: I was recommended to dr.walls by my primary sport orthopedic.the first impression I had was positive. I was a elite competitive runner. last December I was diagnosed with ’avascular necrosis of my left talus bone’ very rare disease at first dr walls recommended doing a total talus replacement I was excited but at the end of the consultation dr walls just wrote a script for the ‘ ideo brace’ and live  the rest of my life with it.2 weeks later I sent him a message and beg him to do the surgery,later that day he replied and said his office was going to get back to me on the date of  MRI and surgery. It’s August and still waiting for he’s office to get back to me..luckily I found the best surgeon who did my surgery now I am walking on my own….my take from dr walls is that he was not confident to do my surgery..but yet I would have more respect for him if he would of take a time to call and tell me he couldn’t or was not confident..very shady dr.

originalText.text: This review is long overdue, but I’ve been out dancing!! Dr. Walz has changed my life immensely, After having a hip replacement I developed Drop foot. Two weeks later I developed CRPS spent four years with a brace and terrible pain. I went to three different orthopedics surgeons and was so happy that I chose Dr. walls he is a amazing Surgeon !!! I finally got rid of the brace and could wear  pretty shoes. I recommend him highly!!!

originalText.text: From diagnosis to multiple surgeries and then going through a Total Ankle Revision, you will not find a more talented,  compassionate and brilliant Surgeon anywhere but here at NYU. His bedside manor is second to none, and his skills are worldwide exceptionally documented.
